Name: Inappropriate Source Code Style or Formatting
Description:

				desired style or formatting for indentation, white
				space, comments, etc.

Entries.IntroText: The usage of symbolic names instead of hard-coded constants is preferred.

Entries.BodyText: The following is an example of using a hard-coded constant instead of a symbolic name.

If the buffer value needs to be changed, then it has to be altered in more than one place. If the developer forgets or does not find all occurrences, in this example it could lead to a buffer overflow.
In this example the developer will only need to change one value and all references to the buffer size are updated, as a symbolic name is used instead of a hard-coded constant.

MappingNotes.Rationale: This entry is primarily a quality issue with no direct security implications.
MappingNotes.Comments: Look for weaknesses that are focused specifically on insecure behaviors that have more direct security implications.
